original_title: Sri Lanka shares close up, turnover at 2 bn
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks closed up on Wednesday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.38 percent, or 39.90 points, at 10,547.
However, the S&P SL20 index of liquid stocks was down 0.31 percent, or 9.22 points at 2,981.
This was mainly made up of one major transaction; a crossing of 21 million Capital Alliance Plc shares (Rs 1.3 bn).
Top contributors to the ASPI included Sampath Bank Plc (up at 67.00), Commercial Bank Plc (up at 84.70), and Lion Brewery (Ceylon) Plc (up at 938.75).
Market participants said there was a bit of renewed buying interest slowly coming in. (Colombo/Nov22/2023)
